title: Time Travel to China, 1750
description: It's the year 1750 in Qing Dynasty China, an era of imperial majesty and complex societal structures. Your journey through time presents an opportunity to influence the future of air quality and the environment. Make your decisions with care:

choices.text: Implement advanced agricultural techniques from the West, such as crop rotation and the use of legumes to enrich the soil.
choices.consequence: Adopting these methods enhances soil fertility and productivity without increasing the need for clearing additional land, thus preserving forests and reducing soil erosion. This leads to better air quality by preventing the release of stored carbon from deforestation.

choices.text: Encourage the expansion of silk and porcelain production, key exports that fuel the economy.
choices.consequence: While boosting economic growth, the increased demand for wood as fuel for kilns and workshops leads to deforestation and air pollution. Over time, this practice contributes significantly to environmental degradation.

choices.text: Support the use of clean, renewable energy sources like wind and water mills to power industry.
choices.consequence: This forward-thinking decision helps to minimize reliance on wood and coal, reducing air pollution and conserving forests. It represents an early move towards sustainable industrial practices, setting a precedent for future generations.

choices.text: Promote the planting of fast-growing trees and bamboo forests to supply the needs of paper and construction, reducing the use of slow-growing hardwoods.
choices.consequence: This initiative not only secures a sustainable supply of raw materials but also contributes to carbon sequestration. The increased green cover helps in purifying the air and maintaining ecological balance, showcasing an early commitment to environmental stewardship.
